ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصْحَٰبِ ٱلْفِيلِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Do you not see what your Lord did with the Companions of the Elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: HAVE YOU NOT seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephants?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephants?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: O dear Prophet (Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), did you not see how did your Lord deal with the People of the Elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the Owners of the Elephant
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with the possessors of the elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord did with the Men of the Elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord dealt with the owners of the Elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the people of the elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hast thou not observed what wise thy Lord dealt with the fellows of the elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Have you not regarded how your Lord dealt with the army of the elephants?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Seest thou not how thy Lord dealt with the Companions of the Elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Have you (O Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) not seen how your Lord dealt with the Owners of the Elephant? [The elephant army which came from Yemen under the command of Abrahah Al-Ashram intending to destroy the Ka'bah at Makkah].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Have you not seen how Allah dealt with the companions of the Elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with the People of the Elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Have you not considered, [O Muhammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [105:1] Have you not considered (an interrogative meant to provoke marvel, in other words, ‘marvel at’) the way in which your Lord dealt with the Men of the Elephant?, who was named Mahmūd, and the men were Abraha, King of Yemen and his troops. He had built a church in San‘ā’ in order to divert pilgrims away from Mecca to it. A man from among the Banū Kināna defecated in it and stained its prayer niche with a deflowered virgin’s blood, in contempt of it. Abraha then swore that he would knock down the Ka‘ba. So he approached Mecca with his troops riding Yemeni elephants with Mahmūd at the vanguard. But when they turned to destroy the Ka‘ba, God unleashed upon them what He relates in His words:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said about the interpretation of Allah's saying (Hast thou not seen): '(Hast thou not seen) i.e. have you not been informed, O Muhammad, in the Qur'an (how thy Lord dealt with) how your Lord punished and destroyed (the owners of the Elephant) the people of the Negus who intended to destroy the House of Allah?
